page.title: 10FARM CROPS
page.content: Farm crops Blackhead. A mixture of barley and oats called dredge corn was grown until 5 years ago.Now barley alone. Some farms using artificial fertilisers carry more stock but will quantity rather than quality last? There is a noticeable reduction in worm population reported. The hedges used to be "cast" with pick and shovel.Now machines are digging deeper. Silage is made for winter feed up to the end of October in big bales in black polythene sacks stacked in the open. One farm at Treleaver has grown barley on the same fields for the last three years. Grass leys are re-seeded every 5 years.
